answers.answer: You need a thorough examination by an M.D. and should get one within the next month. I have no idea what caused your numbness, but the most likely candidate is diabetes and you have classical symptoms of diabetic neuropathy. Generally an insulin clamp procedure or glucose fasting test and an EMG test would be required. I urge you to see a physician as soon as possible because the consequences of untreated diabetes are very real.

question: I am 60 yrs. old.  Both of my feet have become numb on the pads under the toes and and in the middle of the foot.  Also I have one toe ( not the same one ) that has become numb on each foot.I only notice this condition when I go to bed. It is not noticable during the day when walking or aslong as I have shoes on. Can you give some idea what has caused this, and what can I do to getrid of the feeling.
title: foot numbness
